results.title: Compound interest
results.creator_credit: Frank Wilson, Timothy Swartz, Instructional Media, Penn State and WPSX-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Principles of accounting”.
Thomas Casey demonstrates how compound interest increases the time value of money. Present value and future value are explained, and how to compute simple and compound interest, which may involve the use of specially designed tables. The program concludes by showing how interest rates can be stated and how to calculate investment for the future.

results.title: Compost: A Down to Earth Approach
results.brief_description: John Schuman demonstrates how to produce good compost for the garden by using kitchen and garden rubbish. He lists what can be used and what cannot, presents suitable compost bins and enclosures, and shows how to build the compost heap most effectively to produce valuable humus for the garden.
results.description: John Schuman demonstrates how to produce good compost for the garden by using kitchen and garden rubbish. He lists what can be used and what cannot, presents suitable compost bins and enclosures, and shows how to build the compost heap most effectively to produce valuable humus for the garden.

results.title: Composition: as pattern, as structure, as expression
results.creator_credit: Center for Humanities and Eve Cotton
results.brief_description: The arrangement of the elements within a painting is examined. The program shows how the masters have organised their paintings according to the principles of good composition: pattern, from Gozzoli to Matisse; structure, from Pollaiuolo to Cezanne; expression, from Sassetta to Degas.

results.title: Composition and function of blood (TEFC)
results.brief_description: What is concealed in a drop of human blood? What is the role of the blood? This film attempts to provide a detailed illustration of typical properties of human blood, with the aid of animal tests and valuable electron microscopic photographs.

results.title: Composition
results.creator_credit: Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Discusses composition as one of the basic elements of design and illustrates the function of good design, both in the world of art and in industry and everyday life

results.title: Composer Magoo
results.creator_credit: UPA Pictures, Glan Heisch, Henry G. Saperstein, Peter De Met and Grants Simmons
results.brief_description: Mr Magoo attempts to lodge the new song he has just written with the US Copyright Office. He ends up at a talent tryout by mistake where an Elvis look-alike becomes consumed by jealousy after hearing Magoo’s song.

results.title: Complications
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Brook Tesfaye and ACMI
results.brief_description: Brook Tesfaye was born with one complicaton - his left foot was bent. Since his parents couldn’t afford surgery in Switzerland, Brook wore plastic correcting shoes for seven years, until he finally got his foot straight. He talks about the ongoing complications of the bent foot, of the pain, discomfit and subsequent complicatons on his knee and ankle, and how he has lived his life regardless. Despite the pain, Brook is determined to continue playing soccer, a passion he can never give up. He figures that’s how life is - and everyone has their complications.

results.title: Compliance, self control and prosocial behavior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: enhancing social and cognitive growth in children.”.
The socialisation process is important if children are to be raised into healthy adults. Skills and traits children must learn are co-operation, sharing, empathy, self-control, the delay of gratification and empathy which can be enhanced through play. Styles of parenting are discussed together with the technique of modeling to develop positive behaviour and the effect of self-fulfilling prophecies.

results.title: Complex waves: propagation evanescence and stability (TEFC)
results.brief_description: James Mecher at Massachusetts Institute of Technology uses springs to demonstrate the waves equation and then develops this concept to show how it relates to the study of electromagnetic fields and forces as they interact with moving and deformable media.

results.title: Compilation: one hundred entertainments
results.brief_description: One hundred entertainments: Follows an acrobatic troupe in Shensi Province as they perform and talk about their lives. “Son of the ocean”: A film crew travels on a boat on the Yangtze and talks to some of the passengers.
